title: 'Reckless': What league insiders are saying about this stunning set of Bucks moves
content: Damian Lillard waived, Myles Turner to Milwaukee: Here's what the surprise moves mean for the Bucks, the Pacers and the NBA.

title: 'Resilient' Fever, missing Clark, win in-season title
content: Despite being without star Caitlin Clark and playing the league's first-place team on its home court, the 10.5-point underdog Fever defeated the Lynx 74-59 to win the WNBA Commissioner's Cup.

title: Gauff 'mentally overwhelmed,' falls at Wimbledon
content: Coco Gauff became just the third woman in the Open era to lose in the first round at Wimbledon right after winning the championship at the French Open, eliminated 7-6 (3), 6-1 by unseeded Dayana Yastremska of Ukraine on Tuesday night.

title: Sources: Pistons add Robinson in sign-and-trade
content: Free agent sharpshooter Duncan Robinson has agreed to a three-year, $48 million deal with the Detroit Pistons, sources told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Penn to ban trans athletes, ending Thomas case
content: The University of Pennsylvania has agreed to ban transgender women from its women's sports teams to resolve a federal civil rights case.

title: Red Panda injured during Fever-Lynx halftime
content: The popular halftime performer Red Panda was injured at the start of her act at the WNBA Commissioner's Cup championship game at Target Center on Tuesday.

title: Astros' Alvarez to see hand specialist after setback
content: Astros slugger Yordan Alvarez has experienced a setback in his recovery from a broken right hand and will see a specialist.

title: Springer's 7 RBIs help Jays pile on Yankees late
content: George Springer had a career-high seven RBIs, including his ninth grand slam, to help the Blue Jays beat the Yankees 12-5, drawing within one game of the AL East leaders.

title: Sources: Bucks waive Lillard, agree with Turner
content: The Bucks are waiving Damian Lillard and stretching the remaining $113M on his contract in order to acquire free agent center Myles Turner, sources told ESPN.

title: 💰Bobby Bonilla Day! Another $1.19M from Mets
content: Bobby Bo hasn't played for the Mets since 1999, but Tuesday he'll receive his annual hefty check from the team.

title: How the Fever rallied past the Lynx to win the WNBA Commissioner's Cup
content: Playing without Caitlin Clark, Indiana had its best defensive effort of 2025 to win the Commissioner's Cup.

title: Guirassy's double sends Dortmund to CWC QF

title: Toronto ends contracts of Insigne, Bernardeschi
content: Toronto FC have mutually agreed to terminate the contracts of former Italy internationals Lorenzo Insigne and Fernando Bernadeschi, the MLS club announced Tuesday.

title: Kepa joins Arsenal in $6.9M deal from Chelsea
content: Arsenal have completed a deal to sign goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga from Chelsea, the club has confirmed.

content: Haslam Sports Group has sold a 10% stake in the Columbus Crew to the Edwards family at a franchise valuation of $900 million, Sportico reported Tuesday.

title: Ibrahimovic: 'Messi plays with statues' at Miami
content: Zlatan Ibrahimovic defended Lionel Messi following Inter Miami's elimination from the FIFA Club World Cup and likened the superstar's teammates to "statues."

title: Early Club World Cup exit gives Man City time to plan return to Premier League summit
content: Man City's Club World Cup stay was sweet, but all too short. The silver lining, though, is it gives the club time to recover from a disaster 2024-25.

title: Remembering The man who could never say no
content: The youngest son of T.T. Krishnamachari and Rajalakshmi, T.T. Vasu lost his mother when he was very young. His upbringing was largely left to an indifferent grandmother

title: Maharashtra govt announces ex-gratia aid for warkaris in case of mishaps during Pandharpur pilgrimage
content: Scheme offers ₹4 lakh for accidental death and financial assistance for disability and hospitalisation.

title: Lifestyle and pre-existing condition and not COVID-19 vaccination key factor of sudden deaths among adults post COVID: Health Ministry
content: Studies by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) affirm that COVID-19 vaccines in India are safe and effective, with extremely rare instances of serious side effects, the Union Health Ministry said

title: ED searches multiple locations in Delhi over cyber fraud case involving Chinese national
content: Five premises in Delhi are being searched in the case against a company named Xindai Technologies Pvt Ltd; it is alleged that general public was cheated in the name of investments and funds were laundered using full fledged money changers

title: Security forces arrest 4 militants in Manipur
content: Intelligence-based combing operations and cordon and search operations are being carried out extensively to nab those involved in extortion and criminal activities in the State

title: Dalai Lama affirms institution will continue after his death
content: The spiritual head of Tibetan Buddhism asserted that the Gaden Phodrang Trust has sole authority to recognise the future reincarnation, adding that “no one else has any such authority to interfere in this matter”

title: Quad condemns Pahalgam terror attacks, calls for perpetrators to be brought to justice
content: First Quad FM meet narrows focus on China, Indo-Pacific, maritime issues, drops references to Ukraine and Gaza

title: Development of Amaravati: A.P. govt. prescribes a new set of LPS rules
content: The scheme was titled the Land Pooling Scheme, under which land parcels owned by individual farmers or groups of owners were consolidated by the CRDA as per comprehensive development plan

title: L-G flags off first batch of Amarnath Yatra pilgrims from Jammu amid multi-tier security
content: A batch of 5,892 pilgrims, including 1,115 women, 31 children and 16 transgenders left the base camp in the first batch at 4.30 a.m. to join the annual Amarnath pilgrimage

title: PM Modi embarks on 5-nation visit, says ‘India committed to BRICS’
content: During the week-long travel, the PM will visit Ghana, Trinidad and Tobago, Argentina, Brazil and Namibia

title: Truckers go on strike against e-challans in Maharashtra; ‘mixed response’, says transporters’ body
content: The transporters’ demands include stopping forceful recovery of e-challan fines, cancellation of e-challans older than six months, waiving existing penalties, scrapping the mandatory cleaner rule for heavy vehicles, and reconsidering no-entry timings in metro cities

title: Talks on India-U.S. trade pact enter 6th day; India pushes for duty cuts for labour-intensive sectors
content: India has hardened its position on giving duty concessions to American farm products. It is seeking duty concessions for its labour-intensive goods such as textiles, engineering, leather, gems and jewellery

title: Feud between Dr. Ramadoss and Dr. Anbumani creates deep rooted factionalism in PMK
content: Sources in the party said that the ‘competitive’ appointments made by Dr. Ramadoss and Dr. Anbumani to key party posts from district level right down to the grassroots have already created two party structures

title: Karnataka to launch 393 Asha Kirana vision centres to tackle preventable blindness
content: The initiative is aimed at increasing access to eye health services, particularly targeting cataracts and uncorrected refractive errors

title: Uttarakhand makes it mandatory for eateries on Kanwar Yatra route to display food licenses
content: Action will be taken against businessmen who do not follow these instructions under Section 55 of the Food Safety Act 2006, in which a fine of up to ₹2 lakh can be imposed

title: Centre allows use of white board bikes for passenger journeys through aggregators
content: This move brings relief to bike taxi operators like Rapido and Uber, who have long operated in a legal grey area, especially in states like Karnataka, where a recent ban on bike taxis had led to widespread protests

title: Most parts in A.P. likely to receive normal rainfall in July, says IMD
content: Thunderstorms, accompanied by lightning, are likely to occur in isolated places across Andhra Pradesh until July 7, suggests weather forecast

title: Polavaram irrigation project will be commissioned in 2027, says A.P. CM Naidu
content: The NDA government has attracted investment worth ₹9.5 lakh crore to the State in a year, with the potential to create 8.5 lakh jobs, says CM

title: Goa man throws acid on teenage boy to avenge his daughter's suicide; arrested
content: The accused told the police that he stole a five-litre acid can on Friday from the company in Goa where he was employed and hid it in his scooter

title: P.V.N. Madhav takes charge as BJP A.P. unit president, promises to strengthen NDA
content: Madhav vows to resolve internal differences among the alliance partners and secure a stronger role for the BJP within the government

title: YSRCP sympathiser was crushed under Jagan’s vehicle: Naidu
content: Videos gathered by the police during the investigation and forensic report have established that the elderly man was crushed under the vehicle of the YSRCP president, says the Chief Minister

title: When a mysterious tape recorder exploded severely injuring Tamil music director Ganesh
content: The Chennai city police set up two special teams to crack the case. All they had to proceed with was a handwritten note that came with the parcel, containing instructions for activating the deadly device concealed inside what appeared to be a cassette player.

title: During Emergency, Tamil Nadu exceeded targets for male sterilisation under family planning programme
content: However, the State government did not furnish information on the number of cases of sterilisation of unmarried persons, persons having two or less children and persons more than 55 years of age.

title: Groundwater crisis deepens in Karnataka’s hard rock terrain
content: A new study suggests the primary cause of borewell abandonment is severe depletion of the water table rather than groundwater quality issues

title: 5 TVs, 14 ACs: Delhi Chief Minister's House Up For Rs 60 Lakh Renovation
content: The tender issued on June 28 said that of the Rs 60 lakh, five TVs worth Rs 9.3 lakh will be installed at the Chief Minister's house.

title: "Forced To Sell Range Rover For Throwaway Prices": Delhi Man's Viral Post
content: A Delhi man was forced to sell his luxury SUV due to the government's newly enforced "end of life" (EoL) vehicle policy in the national capital.

title: GST Relief For Middle Class Soon: Cheaper Toothpaste, Utensils, Clothes, Shoes
content: After a series of income tax concessions earlier this year, the Centre is now preparing to extend relief to middle and lower-income households in the form of a reduction in Goods and Services Tax (GST), sources have said.

title: "Good Student, That's Why He Became Advocate": 'Mango' Mishra's Father
content: Monojit Mishra, the main accused in the Kolkata law college rape case, was a good student and that's why he could become an advocate, his father Robin Mishra has told NDTV. He refused to speak about the case, which has sparked massive protests

title: Mumbai Teacher Gave Her Student Anti-Anxiety Meds, Sexually Assaulted Him
content: A 40-year-old female teacher of a prominent Mumbai school has been arrested on charges of sexually assaulting a 16-year-old male student on multiple occasions in the past one year, police said.

title: US Bombing "Seriously Damaged" Iran's Fordow Nuclear Site: Minister Araqchi
content: The US bombing of Iran's key Fordow nuclear site has "seriously and heavily damaged" the facility, Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi said in an interview.

title: "Credit Where It's Due": Musk's Praise For Trump Amid Latest Feud
content: Amid escalating tensions with Donald Trump over his flagship "One Big, Beautiful Bill", billionaire Elon Musk praised the US President's negotiating skills on Wednesday, after the Republican leader claimed that Israel was ready to cease fire in Gaza.

title: Kabaddi Player, Bit By Puppy He Was Rescuing, Dies Of Rabies
content: Videos of Brijesh, shot days before his death, show him experiencing a violent rabies attack and writhing in pain.

title: Narayana Murthy Wanted 70-Hour Work Week. Infosys Now Has Work-Life Balance Policy
content: Infosys has flagged the health risks associated with extended work hours, particularly in remote settings.

title: 20 Dead Monkeys Found In Karnataka, Poisoning Suspected
content: Close on the heels of the shocking incident involving the poisoning of five tigers, authorities have recovered the carcasses of 20 monkeys in Chamarajanagar district of Karnataka on Wednesday.

content: On Monday, an airstrike on Al-Baqa massacred at least 24 people, including prominent war reporter and filmmaker Ismail Abu Hatab.

content: Two women have been arrested for robbing a young passenger in Delhi's Kamla Nagar area, said police on Wednesday.

content: Delhi on Wednesday recorded a minimum temperature of 27.6 degrees Celsius, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

title: The Dalai Lama Reveals Succession Plans As China Watches
content: The exiled spiritual leader of Tibet confirmed today that he will have a successor when he dies, reassuring Buddhist followers around the globe that the 600-year-old institution of the Dalai Lama will continue.

title: "So Tempting To Escalate": Musk Responds To Trump's Deportation Threat
content: Billionaire Elon Musk reacted to his simmering feud with US President Donald Trump over the Republican's flagship spending legislation, saying he was "tempted" to escalate the tensions but would "refrain for now".

title: 2 People Who Breached Parliament In December 2023 Get Bail
content: The Delhi High Court today granted bail to Neelam Azad and Mahesh Kumawat, the two people who breached Parliament on December 13 in 2023.

title: "When A Gust Of Wind Blew...": 80-Year-Old On Skydiving From 10,000 Feet
content: Speaking exclusively to NDTV, Dr Shraddha Chauhan, the oldest Indian woman to complete a tandem skydive, credited her son for this feat.

content: A fireworks facility in the Yolo County town of Esparto, California, has exploded and caught fire, prompting widespread panic, road closures, and emergency response operations.

title: Minister Eshwar Khandre seeks report on the deaths of tigers in the last five-and-a-half years in Karnataka
content: Expressing shock over media reports claiming that 82 tigers had died in the State in the last five-and-a-half years, he sought a report to be submitted within 10 days

content: The six accused were arrested when the bribe amount of ₹55 lakh was exchanging hands. The money was delivered in Bengaluru

content: The committee was expected to investigate the incident, assess departmental lapses, and recommend safety measures

title: Pharma factory blast: Over 300 officials in race to trace six missing workers; Factories department suspect static charge and pressure build-up
content: Officials confirmed that 143 individuals were at the facility at the time of the explosion, of whom 74 were affected

title: Over 97,000 criminals convicted under ‘Operation Conviction’ since July 2023: U.P. government
content: ‘In a major success against the mafia, 29 out of 69 identified mafias were convicted, reaffirming that the crackdown is not limited to petty offenders,’ the U.P. government said in a statement

title: Digital copy of certified adoption orders valid, clarifies Central Adoption Resource Authority
content: Clarifying the term "certified copy," CARA said it refers to a digitally authenticated version bearing official attestation, and not a physical original or hard copy.

title: Shipwreck: PIL filed before Kerala HC seeking environmental security deposit
content: The vessel was carrying 643 containers, including 244 with hazardous and noxious substances, 58 with foreign waste, and over 450 metric tonnes of marine fuel.

title: Rains continue to batter Himachal; cloudbursts, flash floods create havoc
content: At least 17 people have died since June 20 in rain-related incidents, which include flash floods, drowning, and electrocution

title: Judiciary should not override executive’s decision to deport a foreign national: Home Ministry
content: The Ministry has appealed against a Jammu and Kashmir High Court order to repatriate a 62-year-old woman who was deported to Pakistan post Pahalgam terror attack

title: Tiruppur dowry death: Husband, in-laws subjected Rithanya to cruelty, reveals police investigation
content: A. Rithanya, daughter of a real estate dealer from Kaikattipudur in Tiruppur, and E. Kavinkumar of Pazhangarai near Avinashi got married on over two months ago on April 11

title: Sanjeev Arora resigns from Rajya Sabha after being elected Ludhiana West MLA
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar accepted Mr. Arora’s resignation with immediate effect, “finding the same in conformity with Article 101 3(b) of the Constitution”

title: No cause for panic over heart attacks, say experts, as Karnataka-appointed panel begins probe over Hassan deaths
content: Public anxiety has led to a surge in outpatient visits at all the three units of Jayadeva— at Bengaluru, Mysuru and Kalaburgi

title: India asks Pakistan to verify nationality of 80 prisoners
content: The two sides exchanged lists of civilian prisoners and fishermen in each other’s custody through diplomatic channels

title: Opposition meeting with Election Commission over special revision of electoral rolls in Bihar deferred
content: Opposition parties led by the Congress have opposed the SIR saying it would lead to disenfranchisement of a large number of people in the State

title: NHAI holds review meet to assess preparations for Amarnath Yatra
content: The meeting was aimed at assessing the preparedness for the yatra set to begin on July 3 related to highway riding surface, lane markings, road safety measures as well as deployment of dedicated quick response teams

title: Bihar Cabinet clears internship, artist pension schemes; sanctions ₹882 crore for Punaura Dham
content: Monthly support for youth undertaking internships; cultural aid for senior artists; temple development on lines of Ayodhya Ram Mandir

title: Confusion reigns as Bihar’s Special Intensive Revision of rolls gets underway
content: Despite EC clarification about the need for proper documentary evidence only applying to 2.93 crore of the State’s 7.89 crore voters, a field visit to villages in Saran district shows apprehension and uncertainty about the exercise among voters

title: A more focused Quad will help deliver better, says Jaishankar
content: The External Affairs Minister says India has “every right” to defend its people against terrorism and the partners of Quad grouping should “appreciate” that; he reiterates India’s commitment to rules-based international order and the “free and open Indo-Pacific”

title: Criminal laws biggest reform since Independence: Amit Shah
content: He said the laws impose strict timelines on the three key pillars responsible for delivering justice to citizens — the police, prosecution, and judiciary

title: India reserves right to deter cross-border terror attacks, Rajnath tells Hegseth, thanks U.S. for support
content: The two leaders had a 20-minute conversation during which Pete Hegseth invited Rajnath Singh to the U.S. for an in-person meeting to take the bilateral defence partnership forward

title: INS Udaygiri: Navy inducts indigenous stealth frigate in record time
content: Delivered in 37 months, remaining five P-17A frigates expected by 2026-end; they represent a “quantum leap” in the Navy’s in-house design capabilities at the Warship Design Bureau, says Ministry

title: Devanahalli: Landlords became farm labourers after losing their lands to projects
content: Devanahalli farmers are not willing to part with their lands for the proposed Aerospace Park at the cost of their livelihood

title: DSP accused in phone tapping case set to be demoted to inspector
content: The accelerated promotion of Praneeth Rao cropped up when the police officials probing the telephone tapping case began analysing different aspects of the case like why the prime accused and former police officer T. Prabhakar Rao specifically chose Mr. Rao and others to eavesdrop on the phones of others

title: Kolkata law college rape case: Accused sent to police custody till July 8
content: Kolkata Police said strict legal action would be taken against individuals attempting to disclose the identity of the survivor

title: RJD and its allies have anti-Constitutional mindset, says BJP
content: The BJP called RJD chief Lalu Prasad and his son Tejashwi Yadav as “faces of jungle raj” who are “determined to pursue communal politics”

title: Girls skipped classes: How rape accused 'Mango's' return turned Kolkata law college into danger zone
content: Kolkata's law college faces turmoil as Monojit Mishra, accused of rape, returns as ad-hoc staff, triggering sharp drop in female student attendance. Students report feeling unsafe due to his intimidating presence and harassment. Mishra, previously expelled for criminal activities, allegedly controls the campus, accessing student data and threatening individuals.

title: Dalai Lama successor: India-based Gaden Phodrang Trust to pick next spiritual leader
content: The Dalai Lama has declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama will persist after his death, with the Gaden Phodrang Trust in India holding the authority to recognise his future reincarnation. He emphasised that the selection process should adhere to past Buddhist traditions, involving consultations with Tibetan Buddhist leaders and Dharma Protectors.

title: IND v ENG: 'Team's needs more important' - Ex-Eng cricketer on Bumrah's availability
content: Mark Butcher urges India to prioritise winning the Edgbaston Test over managing Jasprit Bumrah's workload, emphasising the importance of leveling the series after England's Headingley victory. Despite Bumrah's desire to play at Lord's, Butcher believes his presence is crucial at Edgbaston. Captain Gill confirms Bumrah's availability, with a decision pending pitch assessment.

title: How Trump's planned 'economic bunker buster' bill may impact India
content: US Senator Lindsey Graham proposes a 500% tariff on countries still trading with Russia, aiming to cripple Putin's war efforts in Ukraine. The bill targets nations like India and China, major buyers of Russian oil. India, now heavily reliant on Russian oil, faces potential tariffs on its exports to the US, despite ongoing trade agreement negotiations.

title: Microsoft layoffs: Sales head to go on 8 weeks leave; company says will be back with…
content: Microsoft is set to implement significant layoffs, primarily impacting its sales and marketing division, as part of an ongoing restructuring effort amid substantial AI investments. This move coincides with Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff's planned eight-week sabbatical, scheduled to conclude in September. The layoffs represent the third major workforce reduction this year for the tech giant.

title: 2036 Olympics: India officially enter race to host Games, Ahmedabad named host city
content: An Indian delegation officially presented Ahmedabad's bid to host the 2036 Olympic and Paralympic Games. The bid emphasises the opportunity for young Indians to experience the Olympics at home, promoting the principle of global unity. However, the IOC has paused the host selection process for review due to members' concerns about involvement.

title: China can't choose: Dalai Lama plans to reincarnate - will be reborn abroad
content: The Dalai Lama, ahead of his 90th birthday, has declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama will persist after his death, a statement with significant implications for his global Buddhist followers. He emphasised that the Gaden Phodrang Trust, based in India, will have the exclusive authority to identify his successor, adhering to traditional Buddhist practices.

title: Trusting ChatGPT too much? OpenAI CEO to users; ‘It should be used like a… ’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions users against over-reliance on ChatGPT, highlighting its tendency to 'hallucinate' and produce unreliable information. Despite ongoing advancements and new features, Altman acknowledges the technology's limitations and emphasizes the need for transparency. He also reversed his stance on AI hardware, suggesting that current computers are inadequate for an AI-driven world.

title: 'Very spoilt': Trump warns of 35% tariff as trade deal with Japan falls apart
content: Donald Trump threatened Japan with tariffs of 30-35% if they continue to refuse American rice imports, citing a significant trade deficit. Despite data showing Japan purchased $298 million worth of US rice last year, Trump claimed they "won't take" it. Increased tariff rates may take effect for countries without agreements with Washington after July 9.

title: 'Jinnahwadi party': BJP slams Ajoy Kumar's 'Sikkim a neighbouring country' remark
content: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar triggered controversy by mistakenly referring to Sikkim as a neighboring nation while criticizing the government's foreign policy. The BJP seized on the remark, accusing the Congress of divisive politics and insulting the Northeast. Kumar apologized for the error but questioned the BJP's focus on real issues.

title: Egypt oil ship disaster: Vessel overturns in Gulf of Suez; four dead
content: An oil drilling ship capsized in the Gulf of Suez near Ras Ghareb, Egypt, resulting in at least four fatalities and four missing crew members. Egyptian authorities reported that 22 workers were rescued and hospitalized after the incident, which involved 30 personnel. The Egyptian navy is assisting in the ongoing search for the remaining missing individuals.

title: Trump's warning to Elon Musk on 'Big Beautiful Bill': 'May have to close up shop ...'
content: Donald Trump has escalated his feud with Elon Musk, threatening to withdraw federal subsidies from Musk's companies and suggesting he return to South Africa. This stems from Musk's criticism of the "Big Beautiful Bill," which Trump supports, and Musk's threat to form a new political party. Musk, in turn, advocates for eliminating all subsidies, even those benefiting his own ventures.

title: PM Modi on 5-nation tour: Ghana, Brazil & more on itinerary; Brics, trade in focus
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi embarked on a five-nation tour from July 2-9, visiting Ghana, Trinidad & Tobago, Argentina, Brazil, and Namibia. The trip aims to strengthen India's ties with the Global South, focusing on enhanced cooperation in various sectors like investment, energy, and technology. Modi will engage with leaders and address parliaments, reaffirming India's commitment to multilateral platforms and partnerships.

title: Gold price prediction today: Where is gold rate headed in the near future?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to remain volatile due to evolving global economic conditions. Recent corrective moves followed easing geopolitical tensions and trade policy progress. Mixed economic data from the US, Euro area, UK, Japan, and India influenced market sentiment.

title: 'Perpetrators must be brought to justice': Quad leaders strongly condemn Pahalgam terror attack
content: The Quad foreign ministers strongly condemned the terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir, urging justice for the victims. They voiced concerns over the East and South China Seas, North Korea's missile launches and cyber activities, and the crisis in Myanmar. The Quad also announced initiatives for critical minerals, maritime law enforcement, disaster response, and countering disinformation in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Shweta Tiwari's ex husband allegations: Can't meet daughter Palak
content: Raja Chaudhary, in a recent interview, refuted Shweta Tiwari's accusations of domestic violence during their marriage, which ended in 2012. He claimed Shweta demanded he never meet their daughter, Palak, as a condition for divorce. Raja expressed his sorrow over being cut off from Palak and his family, alleging Shweta used her influence to isolate them.

title: HDB Financial Services listing: Shares make strong market debut at 12.84% premium
content: HDB Financial Services shares made a robust stock market entry, listing at a 12.84% premium of Rs 835 over the issue price of Rs 740. The IPO, which included a fresh issue and an offer-for-sale, witnessed substantial investor demand, closing with an overall subscription of 17.65 times, driven primarily by strong interest from Qualified Institutional Buyers.

title: Kolkata horror: Rapists used inhaler to revive woman, prolong assault
content: A former Trinamool Chhatra Parishad member and two accomplices allegedly revived a gang-rape victim with an inhaler to continue the assault, according to police. The court remanded the suspects in police custody, citing their influence and potential to tamper with evidence. Evidence includes CCTV footage, mobile data, and medical reports corroborating the survivor's account.

title: 7-minute showreel of Ranbir Kapoor starrer 'Ramayana' will leave you ‘awestruck’
content: Excitement surges for Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana,' starring Ranbir Kapoor, Sai Pallavi, and Yash. Taran Adarsh's awestruck reaction to the first glimpse and showreel fuels anticipation. Kapoor, portraying Lord Ram, emotionally wrapped filming, praising the cast's dedication. The epic, featuring Sunny Deol, Ravi Dubey, and others, plans a two-part release, starting Diwali 2026, promising a generational cinematic experience.

title: ACPDC merit list 2025 released for first-year diploma admissions at acpdc.gujarat.gov.in
content: The ACPDC has released the provisional merit list for 2025 first-year diploma admissions in Gujarat. Candidates can view and download the list from the official website, acpdc.gujarat.gov.in. The mock round choice filling will run from July 2–5, 2025, with the final merit list and mock results out on July 10. Round 1 of actual admission choice filling begins the same day. Students must follow the admission timeline closely to secure their preferred diploma seats.

title: IND vs ENG: India may adopt safety-first approach as second Test begins today
content: Ahead of the crucial second Test against England, Team India grapples with team composition uncertainties. Coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill engaged in intense discussions, focusing on the bowling attack. Jasprit Bumrah's likely absence and the choice between Washington Sundar and Kuldeep Yadav add to the dilemma.

title: Japan on edge: Manga's July 5 'disaster prophecy' sparks panic
content: Japan is on edge as a manga artist's prediction of a catastrophic disaster on July 5, 2025, gains traction, fueled by her accurate forecast of the 2011 tsunami. Despite scientific skepticism, the prophecy is impacting tourism and sparking public anxiety, highlighting Japan's vulnerability to natural disasters and the importance of preparedness. The government is urging calm amidst the rising panic.

title: Flying high at 80: India's oldest woman skydives on birthday
content: Dr. Shraddha Chauhan, an 80-year-old woman, has created a record. She became India's oldest woman to complete a tandem skydive. Her son, Brigadier Saurabh Singh Shekhawat, accompanied her. Despite health challenges, she jumped from 10,000 feet. She fulfilled her childhood dream with her son's support. The video of her skydive has gained popularity.

title: 'All should know Marathi': Shop owner thrashed by 'MNS men' for speaking Hindi
content: In Mira Road, suspected MNS members have been booked for allegedly assaulting a sweet shop owner for not speaking Marathi. The incident occurred when the men, reportedly wearing MNS signs, demanded water and an argument escalated over language.

title: A quiet handshake: Carlsen, Gukesh spark buzz ahead of Zagreb showdown - Watch
content: A silent handshake between World Champion D Gukesh and Magnus Carlsen ignited anticipation for their upcoming clash at the Grand Chess Tour in Zagreb. This follows Gukesh's earlier classical win against Carlsen, fueling a generational rivalry. They will compete in rapid and blitz games, with Gukesh aiming to improve his speed chess skills.

title: IND vs ENG Test: What time will England vs India 2nd Test start? What are the session timings?
content: India face a tough decision on playing Jasprit Bumrah in the upcoming Edgbaston Test against England, balancing his workload concerns with the need to level the series after a five-wicket loss at Headingley. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate indicated a late call on Bumrah's inclusion. It was re-emphasised by captain Shubman Gill.

title: BJP MPs object to Medha Patkar's presence; storm out of parliamentary panel meet
content: A parliamentary committee meeting on land acquisition was disrupted when BJP MPs, including Parshottam Rupala, walked out due to the presence of activist Medha Patkar. BJP members labeled Patkar "anti-national," objecting to her involvement. Committee head Saptagiri Sankar Ulaka defended inviting Patkar, citing standard practice.

title: Space missions to watch in 2025 and beyond: Exploring the Moon, Mars, and distant worlds
content: In 2025, space exploration enters a new era with missions to the Moon, Mars, and beyond, led by NASA, ISRO, ESA, JAXA, and private companies. These missions aim to advance scientific knowledge, paving the way for human exploration and technological innovation. From lunar landers to interplanetary explorers, these missions will redefine humanity's place in the cosmos.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex up over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was near 25,600, BSE Sensex moved up over 200 points.

title: Red Panda injured in dramatic fall at Indiana Fever vs Minnesota Lynx; stunt goes wrong
content: During the Commissioner's Cup final between Indiana Fever and Minnesota Lynx, Red Panda fell. The incident occurred at Minnesota’s Target Center during her halftime performance. Medical personnel attended to her after the fall from her unicycle. She was then taken to a hospital. The acrobat, Rong “Krystal” Niu, has been performing since 1993. Fans and fellow performers are showing support.

title: FIDE Ratings: Carlsen still reigns; Praggnanandhaa breaks into World Top 4
content: Indian chess sensation R Praggnanandhaa has broken into the world's top-4, securing the India's number-one rank after his UzChess Cup victory. Magnus Carlsen remains world number one, while D Gukesh slipped to sixth. Fabiano Caruana climbed to third, and Anish Giri re-entered the top-10. In a historic shift, no Russian player is in the top-10.

title: HC asks Mohammed Shami to pay Rs 4L instead of Rs 1.3L as maintenance to estranged wife
content: The Calcutta High Court has significantly increased the monthly maintenance allowance for Hasin Jahan, estranged wife of cricketer Mohammed Shami, and their daughter. The court raised the amount to ₹1.5 lakh for Jahan and ₹2.5 lakh for their daughter, acknowledging that a wife's income doesn't negate her right to financial relief.

title: Infosys vs Cognizant fight! Why are the two IT firms battling it out? Explained
content: Infosys and Cognizant are embroiled in a fierce legal battle over alleged anti-competitive practices in the US healthcare IT sector. Infosys accuses Cognizant of undermining its Helix platform by recruiting key personnel, including former Helix leader Ravi Kumar S. Cognizant, in turn, claims Infosys misappropriated trade secrets related to its TriZetto software.

title: Wimbledon recap: Chaos at SW19 as record-tying 23 seeds perish; Gauff, Pegula, Zverev exit
content: Wimbledon witnessed a shocking start with a record number of top-10 seeds, including Coco Gauff and Alexander Zverev, exiting in the first round. Novak Djokovic battled through a stomach issue with the help of 'miracle pills,' while Alexander Zverev openly discussed his struggles with loneliness and mental health on tour.

title: Big blow for Ukraine: US halts key weapons shipments
content: Under President Trump, the US has suspended certain arms deliveries to Ukraine, citing a DOD review and prioritizing American interests. This decision, impacting Kyiv's defense amid intensified Russian attacks, follows concerns about insufficient US weapons stockpiles. While previous commitments are paused, discussions regarding potential Patriot missile system deliveries continue, even as diplomatic talks have ceased.

title: 'Much less tariffs': Donald Trump hints at closing India-US trade deal soon
content: President Trump announced that the US and India are nearing a trade agreement that would significantly reduce tariffs, creating a more level playing field for businesses. Negotiators are working to finalize the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) before the July 9 deadline, despite India's firm stance on agricultural tariffs. External Affairs Minister Jaishankar remains optimistic about reaching a deal.

title: Int'l students in line of fire again: Trump admin proposes 'fixed period' visas
content: A proposed DHS rule, now under OMB review, seeks to replace 'duration of status' for international students with fixed stay periods, potentially requiring visa extensions. Experts fear increased delays, financial burdens, and uncertainty for students. With Indians comprising a significant portion of international students, the change could adversely affect them, impacting both students and the US education sector.

title: IND v ENG: 'Going for wickets is a lie' - Ashwin urges India to contain Bazball
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has advised the Indian bowlers to prioritise building pressure over aggressively seeking wickets in the upcoming Test against England. He anticipates England will cautiously play Jasprit Bumrah and then aggressively target the other bowlers with their 'Bazball' approach. Ashwin suggests India adopt a more defensive and containment-focused strategy to counter England's aggressive batting style.

title: Travis Kelce reveals who he desperately wants on New Heights — it’s not Taylor Swift
content: Travis Kelce, the NFL star, has revealed his dream podcast guest. It is not his girlfriend, Taylor Swift. Kelce wants Deion Sanders on 'New Heights'. He admires Sanders' dual-sport career in football and baseball. Kelce discussed this on 'Bussin’ With The Boys' podcast. Fans had hoped for a Swift appearance. Kelce's choice has surprised many.

title: This man now leads Sunjay Kapur’s Rs 31,000 crore business empire
content: Following Sunjay Kapur's sudden death, Jeffrey Mark Overly has been appointed Chairman of Sona Comstar. Kapur's ex-wife, Karisma Kapoor, and their children will not inherit his business stake or personal assets. However, they are provided for through bonds and property, while Kapur's wife, Priya Sachdev, becomes a non-executive director at Sona Comstar.

title: ‘Kannappa’ BO collections day 5: Vishnu Manchu’s mythological saga earns Rs 27.45 cr
content: Vishnu Manchu's mythological drama 'Kannappa' is experiencing a decline in box office collections during weekdays, after a promising start. The film has grossed ₹27.45 crore in India across all languages in its first five days. Opening day collections were ₹9.35 crore, but earnings dipped over the weekend and further into the week. Despite a star-studded cast including Prabhas and Akshay Kumar, occupancy rates have decreased.

title: Los Angeles Lakers unveil Statement Edition uniforms for 2025-26 season
content: the lakers announced their new statement edition uniform for the 2025-26 season on monday . the uniform also used a purple base, instead of a gold font for the team name and dark color for the number . it will include the team's signature "LA" logo on both sides of the shorts for the first time on a core uniform .

title: Big upsets: Gauff headlines record-breaking number of top-10 players eliminated
content: pegula beaten 6-2, 6-3 in the first round at the all England club . the world no. 3 had just won the title, the ninth of her career and second on grass . she was hardly the only top-three women's player to lose in the wildly unpredictable opening round .

title: NHL free agency tracker: A flurry of signings on July 1
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: Who won and what questions remain after recruiting's busiest month
content: the most active month of the 2026 recruiting cycle is drawing to a close . Florida, Texas and Texas A&M led the charge among the nation's recruiting risers . Alabama, LSU and Ohio State stand among the prominent football powers poised to rise in July .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: NHL free agency 2025: Signing grades for Granlund, Boeser, Gavrikov, more
content: the 2025 offseason has been a roller coaster with several key players being traded . 224 prospects finding new homes via the draft and a slew of re-signings . the player's fit with his new team, terms of the deal and more will be grading .

title: From Bill Walsh to Bill Belichick: What happens when a legendary NFL coach moves on to college football?
content: a year into retirement from coaching, a former NBC exec says he would have stayed with the 49ers . he says if he wanted the job, it would have put the franchise on a course that didn't lead to Bill Belichick in 2000 . in doing so, he redirected football history .

title: Premier League kit rankings: Every new jersey released so far
content: the top 20 teams will not renew hostilities until mid-August . several of the country's biggest clubs have already unveiled the jerseys . we've kicked off our annual analysis below and will add each new home .

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, live reports
content: Milwaukee's decision to acquire Myles Turner and waive Damian Lillard shakes up the Eastern Conference . the new york Knicks are still looking for a head coach, and the Boston Celtics are dramatically reshaping their roster . Desmond Bane is headed to Orlando in exchange for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope , Cole Anthony .

content: the UFC has put on seven pay-per-view events and 15 Fight Night cards in eight U.S. states and seven international countries . we've seen six new champions crowned (one of whom didn't even have to fight for it), six title defenses and countless knockouts .

title: MMA divisional rankings: Where does Topuria stand at lightweight? What about Makhachev?
content: Ilia Topuria beats Charles Oliveira via knockout in the first round . the lightweight division is in flux . there's a traffic jam at the top of the 155-pound rankings . it will be resolved once Jack Della Maddalena takes place at 170 pounds .
